repnme.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Privatization and
            Enterprise Sector Adjustment Credit (PESAC) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Privatization and
            Enterprise Sector Adjustment Credit (PESAC) Project for
            Kyrgyz Republic were as follows: outcomes were highly
            satisfactory, project sustainability was likely, Bank
            performance was highly satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also highly satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the Privatization and Enterprise Sector
            Adjustment Credit has served to confirm the lessons that
            have been learned earlier with other adjustment operations
            and also lessons that are being learned as Bank continues to
            provide support to transitional economies. When and where an
            enterprise was privatized through transferring a controlling
            block of shares, the new owners have demonstrated their
            capability to be efficient owners, contributing to the
            corporate governance and efficiency. It will be important to
            further closely monitor and explore the privatization
            process in the Kyrgyz Republic and elsewhere in transitional
            economies, to obtain more solid empirical evidence on the
            impact of various privatization policies on the performance
            of privatized enterprises. Pre-privatization restructuring
            also helped greatly to enable or accelerate the
            privatization of these companies: 15 out of 21 restructured
            enterprises have already been privatized, and the remaining
            6 are currently candidates for privatization.

            Adjustment Credit (Pesac) -- P008514

repnme.cdata!:
Kyrgyz Republic - Privatization and
            Enterprise Sector Adjustment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Privatization and Enterprise Sector
            Adjustment Credit will be quick-disbursing and will provide
            balance of payments support, linked to the conditionality
            specified for first and second tranche release.  The first
            tranche will become available upon credit effectiveness, and
            the second tranche, upon a review, satisfactory to the
            International Development Association, of successful
            implementation of the adjustment program as a whole; and
            fulfillment of the specific tranche release conditions.  The
            proceeds of the credit will be used for financing the
            foreign exchange costs of general imports, except for a
            small negative list of ineligible goods.
